page.title: 03THE EARL OF LICHFIELD
page.content: Shugborough is the home of the Earl of Lichfield,his wife Lady Leonora and their three children. Lord Lichfield only attends the State Opening of Parliament,but in later years hopes to have time for Parliamentary debates. He is a professional photographer and his work takes him abroad regularly. Last year he travelled 380,000 miles by air. Lady Leonora is a Lady-in-Waiting to Princess Anne. Life has changed dramatically since Lord Lichfield's youth at Shugborough when the Anson family had 39 indoor and 70 outdoor staff. Now they employ a couple to maintain their private quarters with a few cleaning staff. He and his sister had to spend school holidays working as "understudy" to each servant in turn. This gave them a greater understanding of the servants' work and feelings.
